artefact.alternative_title: How much it costs to apply or renew a passport, and how to pay
artefact.overview: How much it costs to renew or get a new adult or child passport, which services are available and how to pay
artefact.body:
A standard adult passport costs £72.50 and a child passport costs £46.00 if you apply by post.

The Post Office Check & Send service costs an additional £8.75.

If you need to get a passport urgently you can use the Fast Track or Premium services, which cost more.

  Normal service by post One-week Fast Track service One-day Premium service
Adults (16 and over)      
Renew or amend an existing adult passport £72.50 £103.00 £128.00
First adult passport - if you have previously held a child passport issued in the UK £72.50 £103.00 £128.00
First adult passport - if you have never held a child passport issued in the UK £72.50 Not available Not available
Replace a lost, stolen or damaged adult passport £72.50 £112.50 Not available
Jumbo 48-page passport (first passport) £85.50 Not available Not available
Jumbo 48-page passport (renewing your passport) £85.50 £111.00 £137.00
Children (under 16)      
First child passport (includes children previously on a parent’s passport) £46.00 £87.00 Not available
Renew or amend an existing child passport £46.00 £87.00 £106.50
Replace a lost, stolen or damaged child passport £46.00 £87.00 Not available
People born on/before 2 September 1929      
Renew or get a passport Free £30.50 £50.50

How your documents will be sent back

The Identity and Passport Service (IPS) will send out your new passport by secure delivery and return your supporting documents separately by second-class post.

You can pay an extra £3 to get your supporting documents sent back to you via secure delivery. You don’t have to pay the extra £3 if you’ve applied for a jumbo passport.

How to pay

How you apply Debit card/credit card accepted Cheque/postal order accepted Cash accepted
Using the Post Office Check & Send service Yes Postal order only - payable to ‘Post Office Ltd’ Yes
By post Yes - complete the form in the application pack Yes, payable to ‘Identity and Passport Service’ No
In person at a Regional Passport Office Yes Postal order only - payable to ‘Identity and Passport Service’ Yes

The passport fee is non-refundable if you withdraw your application or if you’re not eligible for a passport.

Extending restricted validity passports

If you need to extend a passport that was originally issued for a restricted period, this is free if the passport was issued before 1 May 2008.

Extending a restricted validity passport issued on or after 1 May 2008 costs:

  Normal service by post One-week Fast Track service One-day Premium service
Adult £72.50 £103.00 Not available
Child £46.00 £87.00 Not available
